      • start

        public boolean start()
        Starts the core systems.

        Does not work if the core has been decommissioned.

        Returns:
        True if okay. False if the core has been decommissioned.

      • setCallback

        public void setCallback(@NonNull
                        CoreCallback callback)
        Sets the callback method that the ui can provide to get indications from the core. see CoreEvent.java for further details.

        Does not work if the core has been decommissioned.

        Parameters:
        callback - The ui should provide a callback that will called by the core in case of important events. see CoreCallback.

      • setForegroundServiceNotification

        public void setForegroundServiceNotification(@NonNull
                                             android.app.Notification fgsn)
        Sets the foreground service notification. Call this method in your application class in onCreate().

        Does not work if the core has been decommissioned.

        Does not work if the core has been decommissioned.

      • isStalled

        public boolean isStalled()
        Returns true if the core has been stalled. See CoreEvent.CORE_IS_STALLED and CoreEvent.CORE_IS_READY.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the core has been stalled. Returns true if the core has been decommissioned.

      • pauseScanningFor

        public boolean pauseScanningFor(long time)
        Paues the scanning for other apps for the amount of minutes.

        Does not work if the core has been decommissioned.

        Parameters:
        time - The length of time how long the scanner has to wait.
        Returns:
        false if the number is bigger then MAX_PAUSE_TIME or the core has been decommissioned.

      • pauseAdvertisingFor

        public boolean pauseAdvertisingFor(long time)
        Pauses the advertising for the specified amount of time.

        Does not work if the core has been decommissioned.

        Parameters:
        time - The amount of time to pause.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the pause have been set. False if the pause was too long. Max 2h. Or the core has been decommissioned.

      • isScanningEnabled

        public boolean isScanningEnabled()
        Return true if scanning is enabled.

        Does not work if the core has been decommissioned.

        Returns:
        Return true if scanning is enabled.

        Does not work if the core has been decommissioned.

      • setBluetoothKeepAlive

        public void setBluetoothKeepAlive(boolean enable)
        True if the core should keep the bluetooth switched on. Warning: This can conflict with the user experience.

        Does not work if the core has been decommissioned.

        Parameters:
        enable - true if the core should keep the bluetooth switched on.

        Returns:

      • setApiEndpoints

        public void setApiEndpoints(@NonNull
                            java.lang.String json)
                     throws org.json.JSONException,
                            InvalidBackendEndpointException,
                            MissingBackendEndpointException,
                            InvalidBackendEndpointFormatException
        Sets the endpoints.

        Does not work if the core has been decommissioned.

        Parameters:
        json - Ths json with endpoints. You can find an example in the docs/util folder.
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - If the json format is wrong.
        InvalidBackendEndpointException - If the user has specified an invalid endpoint name.
        MissingBackendEndpointException - If a specific endpoint is missing.
        InvalidBackendEndpointFormatException - If the number of endpoints in the json is wrong.

      • decommission

        public void decommission()
        Decommissions the core functions. After calling this method the core functions can't be used anymore. A new installation is necessary to make the app ready for use again.

        This method should be used after the upload has been finished.

        Does not work if the core has been decommissioned.

      • hasBeenDecommissioned

        public boolean hasBeenDecommissioned()
        Returns true if the core functions has been decommissioned.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the core functions has been decommissioned.

      • setEnableTelemetry

        public void setEnableTelemetry(boolean enable)
        Enables or disables the telemetry data.

        Do not use this function on the final product.

        Does not work if the core has been decommissioned.

        Parameters:
        enable -

      • getEnableTelemetry

        public boolean getEnableTelemetry()
        Returns true if telementry is enabled.
        Returns:
        Returns true if telementry is enabled.

      • checkForNewMessages

        public void checkForNewMessages(boolean withFeedbackWhenNoMessages)
        Starts a request to check if new messages have arrived by the health authority that are directed to you. Possible events: NEW_MESSAGES_ARRIVED, CHECK_MESSAGES_FAILED.

        Does not work if the core has been decommissioned.

        Parameters:
        withFeedbackWhenNoMessages - When true you also get NO_NEW_MESSAGES in case there is no message.

      • requestAllMessages

        public void requestAllMessages(java.lang.String locale)
        Requests a list of Messages objects. Possible events: LOAD_ALL_MESSAGES_SUCCESSFULLY, LOAD_ALL_MESSAGES_FAILED.

        Does not work if the core has been decommissioned.

        Parameters:
        locale - The language of the messages you are requesting.

      • confirmMessage

        public void confirmMessage(java.lang.String messageId)
        After retrieving the new messages with requestAllMessages you need to confirm each one of them.

        Does not work if the core has been decommissioned.

        Parameters:
        messageId - The id of the message you want to confirm. see Message.getId().
